title: Steph Houghton's own goal makes history repeat itself for Manchester City
text:
Manchester City Women have lost three games on the bounce for the first time since May 2015 following their 2-1 second-leg defeat by Atlético Madrid in the Women’s Champions League - the second season in succession they have exited the competition at the hands of the Spanish side.

A first-half own goal from England captain Steph Houghton, from Ludmila’s cross, gave Atlético a 2-1 aggregate lead before Angela Sosa's finish from close-range fired the hosts out of sight in the last 16-tie. Pauline Bremer’s late consolation goal was not enough for City, who reached the semi-finals in 2016-17 and 2017-18.

The defeat in Madrid was a third straight defeat in all competitions for City, who lost 1-0 to Arsenal in the Women’s League on Sunday and 2-0 to Manchester United in the League Cup the weekend before.

It is City’s worst run since successive defeats by Arsenal, Liverpool and Chelsea in April and May four years ago.

“It’ll hurt the players and staff, but last year we lost this game in the round earlier and we went on to win two trophies,” said Nick Cushing, the Manchester City manager. “We felt that we probably should have pushed the league - it was there for us to win last year and we just felt a little bit short. We have to use this as a positive.
